question: A uniform magnetic field of strength B = 2 mT exists vertically downwards. These magnetic field lines pass through a closed surface as shown in the figure. The closed surface consists of a hemisphere S1 a right circular cone S2 and a circular surface S3. The magnetic flux through S1 and S2 are respectively
images/f8a9b0c1-d2e3-4f4a-5b6c-7d8e9f0a1b2c.png
explanation: Note: The source marks this question as Bonus/Ambiguous due to unit issues.
Physically, flux entering the open surface of the hemisphere or cone from the uniform field equals $B \times Area_{projected}$.
Calculated values depend on the interpretation of radius units provided in the diagram.
